intro: Holi is about joy, not discomfort. Please follow these simple guidelines so everyone has an amazing time.

principles.title: Ask Before You Throw
principles.description: Always check before throwing colour at someone. Some people prefer to watch rather than participate in colour play, and that's perfectly okay.

principles.title: Respect 'No'
principles.description: If someone says no or signals they don't want colour thrown at them, respect their wishes immediately. No means no â€” no exceptions.

principles.title: Be Gentle with Children
principles.description: Use only small amounts of colour with young children. Avoid throwing colour near their eyes or face. Let parents guide how their children participate.

principles.title: Ask Before Photographing
principles.description: Always ask permission before taking photos or videos of others, especially children. Not everyone wants to appear on social media.

principles.title: Avoid the Face
principles.description: Aim colour at the body, not the face. Be especially careful around eyes, mouth, and nose. If colour gets in someone's eyes, help them rinse with clean water immediately.

principles.title: Include Everyone
principles.description: Holi is for everyone regardless of age, background, or ability. Welcome newcomers warmly and explain traditions to first-timers.

principles.title: Clean Up After Yourself
principles.description: Help keep Central Park beautiful. Dispose of colour packets and food waste in the bins provided. Leave the venue as you found it.

principles.title: Stay Sober & Safe
principles.description: This is a family-friendly event. Excessive alcohol consumption is discouraged. Look out for one another and report any concerns to event marshals.

emergencyNote: If you witness or experience any unwanted behaviour, please speak to any volunteer marshal (wearing yellow vests) or visit the Information Tent near the Main Entrance.
